results.title: Exogenous intoxication by non-prescribed use of vitamin D, a case report
results.text_hl: The procedures performed were mainly vigorous hydration (50 ml/kg in 2 h), @CHEMICAL_Furosemide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005665 @@@furosemide@@@, @CHEMICAL_Diphosphonates @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004164 @@@bisphosphonates@@@ and blood pressure control with @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@. Related to @<m>DISEASE_Hypervitaminosis_A</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006986 @@@hypervitaminosis@@@, behavior measures were conducted, with immediate cessation of supplementation use.

citations.NLM: de Paula ALT, Gonzaga WPF, Oliveira LM, Feibelmann TCM, Markus J. Exogenous intoxication by non-prescribed use of vitamin D, a case report BMC Geriatr. 2020 Jun 24;20(1):221. PMID: 32580697
